;;B;;REAKING (WHICH; you may know as breakdancing) will make its Olympic debut—the only sport to do so—at this summer's Paris games. It joins new urban sports ;BMX;, skateboarding and 3v3 basketball, which debuted at Tokyo 2020, and is part of a broader shift by the International Olympic Committee to include more youth-oriented events. Yet breaking is judged in a completely different way—a way that ensures audiences will see something entirely new at these Olympics.

;

;Breakers are judged against five evenly weighted criteria: technique, execution, musicality (keeping in mind breakers don't know what music will play ahead of time), vocabulary (range and repertoire of moves), and originality (new moves, personal style, spontaneity).不是每个舞者的特定动作都得到单独的分数，而是使用比较系统来评判。也就是说，参赛者在每一轮战斗中都直接与对手进行比较。 The breaker with the most judges' votes wins that round, and the one with the most rounds at the end wins the battle.

;

;The openness of this judging system allows for variety, spontaneity and newness: a breaker known for their artistry has just as much of a chance as one whose speciality is athleticism.它保证了一系列曲目的展示。 Moreover, penalties for repeating major moves or movement sequences ensure that individual repertoires will be varied.

;特朗普于 2020 年任命的法官艾琳·坎农 (Aileen Cannon) 自从被随机分配审理此案以来，她一直在处理两起名为“美国诉特朗普”的诉讼中的第一起诉讼2023 年 6 月。本周的裁决认为，起诉从一开始就是非法的。特别检察官杰克·史密斯的任命违反了宪法的“任命条款”，即第二条中要求“美国官员”由总统提名并经参议院确认的规定。

;对任命官员的“严格宪法限制”对于美国的发展至关重要。卡农法官写道，权力分立。允许司法部长梅里克·加兰（Merrick Garland）任命一名普通公民担任特别顾问，“篡夺”了国会的角色，并摧毁了“结构性自由”。她总结道，“放松”宪法限制的后果是“严重的”，然后引用了 1952 年最高法院的一项著名判决，该判决警告人们不要“不受限制地无视那些限制，即使是最无私的权威主张”。
